I have ordered here many times.  I love their food.  Food is awesome.  But when it comes TO following basic instructions, they fail to the highest degree.  All I ask is that they call when they are here and give me cutlery, forks and spoons. .  I never complained about it, only once I did.  Maybe they will read this and correct the problem.
Today 010415 the driver did call and did bring spoons and forks.  
Sometimes they forget to call and sometimes they forget you requested cutlery and forget to bring it.  If they corrected that I would give a better rating.
author: Pat W.

description:
This is the best Chinese food in the area, hands down. We always order for delivery on EAT24.

The Ma Po Tofu and Mongolian Beef are the two highlights for us. The Hot & Sour Soup is good as well.
author: Chris T.

description: We ordered delivery. Everything was okay. Nothing was great. My favorite was the mushu pork. Despite the pancakes being dysfunctional, the flavor was nice. The Mapo tofu was shockingly bland. We requested the dish be spicy - pretty sure there was not a single chili in it. Def won't be trying this place again.
author: Laura G.

description:
Delicious dinner, kind & attentive staff, and easy parking makes this place my next favorite.  

I ordered honey walnut prawns for $12.95, a Tsingtsao for $4, worth it for a calm Sunday evening in a clean, trendy restaurant.
author: Ann B.

description: The Wor Won Ton Soup was spot on...good broth, deep flavor, plus excellent and generous quantities of all of the many ingredients that are a part of this soup. Never been a great fan of their version of chow fun (bland), but this time it was better, ...good noodles and plenty of the BBQ pork (choice of several meats) and just short of hitting the right depth of flavor. Prawns with sweet pea was good and again, generous, but again, somewhat bland. Also had the onion pancakes. Win Garden's version of this dish are made thin and crispy...which I like, opposed to the many places that deliver a thick gummy mess. Not much of an onion flavor, but still, I would order it again. My sense is that Win Garden succeeds in using fresh and good quality ingredients, but really needs to bump up the intensity of their flavors. ...That special something that makes a dish zing!
author: Robert B.

description:
I've lost count of how many times our office has ordered lunch from here (I'm pretty sure we've ordered from here once a week for a month or so)! The combination of the good food and super fast delivery makes it hard to order Chinese food anywhere else.

Our usuals are:
- General Tso Chicken lunch special w/ egg fried rice
- Jalapeño fried rice
- Wor Wonton soup
- Crab rangoons

We aren't big fans of the egg flower soup that usually comes with the lunch special. BUT their hot and sour soup is delicious! We're never disappointed with the food and somehow always surprised at how fast they deliver--no matter if it's the middle of the lunch rush. We'll continue to order here for as long as the food quality and delivery speed stays the same!
author: Allison M.

description: This restaurant is a typical Chinese American offering and doesn't deserve more than average at best. I ordered eggplant with scallops and shrimp. It looked ok but as I ate it it left a pool of oil behind. I called Grub Hub who delivered it and told them I thought it was not acceptable and who gave them a highest quality rating?  I was told to contact the restaurant and I went to bring in the food of which 50-60% was left and the server behind the counter said I had eaten all of it. It was sitting right there in front of me. I asked if their dishes all swam in pools of oil and she said that is how it comes and would t offer me anything. I'll never go back to this place and wouldn't recommend d it.
author: Paul B.

description: Have ordered from here multiple times for delivery. It's been perfect every time (by my standards). Arrives hot, tastes good and is consistent!   A few times delivery has been delayed due to the restaurant being busy ( 90 minutes one time) but to me it's worth the wait...
author: K H.

description: I am giving the restaurant a dot because the customer service I received did not deserve a star...it was offensive .  I went in to order take out, I was asked to set in the front of the restaurant.  I set down and settled into the menu.  Then I was asked to move because there was a party of six who needed the setting .  No problem.!.  We asked where should we sit, she points to the table in the middle of the restaurant.   I noticed that she never came my way, so I stopped her to let her know we were ready to place our order. She told us to go back up front to place our order.  I gave up at this point and went to another restaurant. This is the thing... had I not stopped her ... I guess she would have continued to ignore me ...she couldn't  even take my order ... really!  Patronizing a business should never be this difficult.
author: Deborah O.

description: Absolutely horrible customer service for really mediocre food. Unbelievably dissatisfying experience.
author: Nicholas P.

description: Awful example of service. These guys suck and shouldn't be open as a business. Hopefully they close soon!
author: John Michael N.

description: We've ordered takeout from here several times and it's always delicious. The food comes quickly and is hot and fresh. I've never dined here in person but I'll definitely continue to order takeout!
author: Diana G.

description: I've gotten a lot of Chinese take out from a lot of places in SF and this place is the only take out chicken chow mein that i didn't have to hold my breath and douse heavily with sauce to snarf down. When I ate this I was just like "damn these ingredients won't give me a terrible bowel movement." However more importantly, I haven't been able to find a Chinese place with cream cheese /crab rangoons anywhere in all of the Bay Area, until I hit up Win Garden. Y'all r killin it
author: Mikayla M.

description: My friend and I ordered Crab Rangoon, pork potstickers, chicken fried rice, & General Tsao chicken. The food was great. And our host/waiter was awesome; He was very attentive & paid attention to detail. Highly recommend this place!
author: Jane S.

description: The meatless chicken, although didn't taste like chicken, tasted pretty good! The food was delicious but the delivery time was around an hour and 30 minutes. They did warn us about this wait time, but it is longer then average from my experience.
author: Sawlat T.

description:
I have been in the throes of the flu for the past week.  So, we have been ordering from Win Garden almost every night.  The food consistently arrived quickly and the customer service has been spot on.

More importantly, last night, we ordered the Chef's Special Dry Braised Chicken Wings (Spicy)!  Dare I say that they are as good as San Tung?  These are better because they can be delivered to your home (super easy to order directly from Yelp)....and come with a side of excellent customer service!  I am all over that and will continue to order from Win Garden...again and again and again!!  I encourage you to do so too!
author: Karla F.

description: So I order lemon chicken for pick up. I arrive and tell the dude at cashier my order and he's quick to correct me saying I ordered WALNUT CHICKEN. I told him I ordered lemon chicken and he insists he repeated the ordered but in reality he hung up on me instantly right after my order.. The fact he lied saying he repeated it and gave me attitude as if it was my fault he messed up. That alone will make me NEVER COME BACK HERE AGAIN!!! How are you gona blame the customer when it was your mistake?! I walked out f* this place!! Bad service!!!
author: Illa C V.

description: I ordered food from here through Yelp a couple weeks ago when I was in the recording studio with my band. Delivery was great and the food was REALLY good. I only wish I had gotten more plates, napkins, and utensils, but overall it was really good stuff. I'll definitely keep them in mind next time we're there.
author: Brent I.

description: So far so wonderful..the customer service is good .....food was Excellent. We were skeptical of coming in here after the old restaurant closed HONG SING. But now, WIN GARDEN, thank you ...food was good. Now I'm not afraid to come here.
author: Braddah Rick M.

description:
After my original review (9/2014) I noticed a bunch of new reviews with four and five star ratings, so I thought I'd give it another shot in case maybe something had changed.

Sorry, but it hasn't.  Tonight's choices were dry-sauteed string beans and Szechuan chicken. The overwhelming flavor of both was salt.  Not chili, or spicy, but just plain  NaCl. They were exceedingly, almost painfully salty, to the exclusion of virtually all other flavors.

SF has some of the best Chinese food in the lower 48 but sadly this still isn't it. It's unexciting at best and, as tonight showed, incredibly salty at worst. I really, really wish it were otherwise since the prices are reasonable, it's very close to my house, and I really like to support our neighborhood businesses--but sadly I won't be returning; one chance for an update seems like enough.
author: A.J. F.

description: I have only ordered this for delivery but everything was very good. We ordered the black bean chicken, chicken fried rice, chow mein. The black bean chicken was very interesting and even had mushrooms. It tasted very authentic. We will define toy order again.
author: Paul D.

description: Tastiest Chinese food I've had in SF! The Wonton soup is so flavorful-- I've never had anything like it! The string bean chicken was so tasty. Great job on adding flavor to everything!
author: Lissette L.

description: Chicken: does it salt and pepper? It's not as succulent as its pork and squid standards. However the bird is the missing link yearned by surf and turf enthusiasts. Lemons would have made this dish a perfect ten.
author: Edward G.

description:
Been to Win Garden a ton of times. My go to Chinese place. 
They are super fast. Always here/ready at their locale for pickup on time and more likely 5-15 mins early. 
Everything is in generous portions, fresh and delicious.

The general tso chicken. Always gone at my house, even if we get two. TRY IT

The veggie chow mein is awesome. Not super greasy, lots of good veggies (snap peas!), not just the cheap ones, fresh.

BBQ pork buns are a little pricey but I've tried a bunch and theirs are solid. 

The crab rangoons are a staple, super delicious.

The only things I didn't love were separated from me by preference. I like a modest amount of ginger and spice, and thus didn't enjoy the veggie potstickers and the jalopeno chow fun respectively. The potstickers were handmade though, and bomb otherwise, so I suppose I could order and ask for less. Same for the chow fun.

Seriously, try them. They're great.
author: Shaymaa M.

description:
Fastest delivery time I've ever had, decent food. They don't read the special instructions on the eat24 request but whatever. 

Good Chinese food, had fried rice and sui mai.
author: Rohan D.

description: The second- and last time- we ordered from here. Overpriced, poor quality and rude staff. Knowing it was Friday of a holiday weekend, I ordered online an hour in advance; specifying the pickup time as 8:05 PM (the order website has you do this, it's not a special thing). Arrived at just that time and found the food completely stone cold. They'd obviously made it was soon as order came in, disregarding the specified pick up time. The expensive Garlic Broccoli was not as pictured as chinese broccolini-type vegetable, stir fried with a sauce.. It was just plain, virtually raw brocolli, no sauce and only a sprinkling of chopped garlic, not stirfried- maybe steamed for 30 seconds? It was raw! - for $11! The roast duck was advertised as a half duck but obviously wasn't- there was no wing and only half a leg & who knows how much more of the "half" was missing.The salt & pepper chicken wings tasted like the meat was going bad & also overpriced at $13.The shrimp dumpling wrapper was really gummy inside, vegetarian potstickers were bland & not tasty at all.. I so regret not going to San Tung for their fabulous dry fried greenbeans ($7.25) and wings ($10); so much better pricing and quality..On top of it, staff was rude. The website doesn't allow you to pay in advance if you pick up, so had to stand there waiting as food got even colder, as gal (30's, with orthodonture) took phone orders . Other staff were milling around, wiping tables & sweeping and standing in doorway of kitchen looking out; so I asked to pick up my order as gal was on phone. Gal got mad and said "we busy!!" (apparently I'm not). The name on the receipt on the bag was not mine or anything close to mine ("Lars") , but when I questioned if it was the right order, she got mad and tore that corner of the receipt off - weird! Sixty dollars for take-out food for two w/o any drinks or dessert- and she can't even be bothered to say "thank you" or  "enjoy your dinner" or "come again".. she just took my money in a cold, hurried way.
author: Sue W.

description:
I have only ordered delivery from them and the experience each time has been great. 

I live in bernal heights and the delivery times have been faster than a place closer to me on Mission.

The food is very solidly good. Not too greasy or overly salty. I like that they send the sauce for general's tofu separate from the tofu. The green beans are perfectly tender while retaining a little bit of crispness. 

The portions are also large. I order 3 dishes which is enough for a dinner and lunch the next day for two people. I make rice at home so I don't need to buy it. 

Overall a great option for reasonably priced, tasty,  (relatively) quick option for delivery.
author: Eric L.

description:
Since this is the only Chinese restaurant that I know of in Glen Park and is walking distance from my home, I WANTED to love this place . . . .I really WANTED to . . .but I just didn't. 

I was pet-sitting for a friend while she was on vacay in Paris and strolled across this place during one of my many doggie walks.  Normally, I only window browse because I can't go inside any shops with the dog but this time, I was so hungry that I came up with the idea of calling in my order from my cell phone and letting them know I was right outside the door.  Searching for my cellphone while balancing an antsy dog, a plastic bag full of dog poop, and another plastic bag full of dog treats proved to be more difficult than I bargained for so I plopped myself down on the sidewalk while I searched.  That's when the waiter popped his head out of the restaurant (probably to see why I was there).  He was very polite and agreed to take my order and bring the food out to me when it was done.  

I ordered the Chinese broccoli with chicken ($9.95) and the jalapeno fried rice ($8.95).  The food was done in 15 minutes and cost $20.95 (or $25 with tip).  I was SO excited about finding the place and couldn't wait to bring it home and try it.  I actually live in the Excelsior/Portola neighborhood but don't enjoy walking down Mission as much as Glen Park (Glen Park is just so charming!).  I have family visiting me soon and was looking for nearby places that they can walk to while I'm at work and, since my dad LOVES Chinese food, I hoped that this could be THE spot.  

But, unfortunately, despite loving the location of the restaurant, appreciating the staff, and finding the appearance of the restaurant to be nicer than what is available on Mission Street, I just REALLY couldn't get past the food and would probably walk over to Henry Hunan's for Chinese in the future rather than this spot.  The portions were plentiful (my order could have fed 2-4 people) and the prices were reasonable however the Chinese broccoli and chicken dish was actually rabe and chicken.  I know that Chinese broccoli looks a lot like rabe but rabe is distinctively different in taste (much more bitter) and has enough visual differences (leaf edges and size of broccoli florets are different) that the chef should have spotted the mistake.  I find rabe to be too bitter for my palate and can only stand to eat it in small quantities or when it's disguised by other food components. Although the vegetable was cooked beautifully, I couldn't enjoy it. Since the dish was mostly rabe and was the main ingredient, the mistake was just too much to bear.

And the jalapeno fried rice was not very good.  It wasn't the worst fried rice I had (that award goes to a restaurant in San Antonio, TX which served inedible fried rice) and it wasn't so disgusting that I COULDN'T eat it but it was bad enough that I didn't want to.  There were no jalapenos in the jalapeno fried rice but there was plenty of stale red hot chili oil (I don't know why a new restaurant would have stale oil either).  There was also some other weird smell/taste to the dish that I know I had before but couldn't quite identify. And, oddly, after sifting through the rice to pick out meat (for the dog) I found a single shrimp in the fried rice.  I don't know if shrimp was supposed to be included or not (I don't remember) but thought it was odd that I would have a quart of fried rice and a single shrimp in it.  Boo!

In all, I give the food 2 stars & the service 4 for an overall rating of 3.  So sorry Win Garden, but I probably won't be back.
author: Linda H.

description: I ordered delivery and to my surprise, it arrived very quickly. I got the eggplant with shrimp, sizzling rice soup, and Chinese broccoli. Everything came hot and was really tasty. The portions were big, too. I will definitely order from here again!
author: Nina K.

description: Hot, fast, and courteous, easy to place the order over the phone. Meal was perfect! Plenty of meat in the dish.
author: Nik H.

description:
I'm so excited for this place. Finally a decent chinese food place in Glen Park!! 

We order take-out and delivery from this place all the time. They are fast! Although it helps that we live 5 minutes away. 

Their food always comes hot and fresh. It's not exactly cheap, but the portions ate plentiful.

We've tried the following and would order all again: 

Beef Curry - a place that finally makes it extra spicy for me 
Mah Poh tofu 
Gon Chow Ou HOI
author: Winny F.

description:
Had a quick dinner here during the first game of the World Series and glad to see that the inside wasn't too loud like the bars around here.

Dinner for two just consisted of the Dragon Beef and two sides of rice. The Dragon Beef was more or less sweet and spicy deep fried thin strips of beef which I enjoyed quite a bit, but less so for my guest. It's a shame that the rice bowls are priced separately rather than per guest because that would easily give this place a solid 4 stars. For a buck fifty, you get a relatively small bowl of rice and with dishes that taste pretty salty, you're gonna want some rice to dull out a lot of the saltiness.

Overall, not a bad place to pick up dinner if you're in the neighborhood.
author: George Z.

description: Pretty below average.  Beef fried rice that I ordered for dinner was clearly not made to order.  It was the mass stuff that was used as part of the lunch specials.  The rice was mealy/sticky and the beef was questionable.  If a Chinese restaurant can't do fried rice, then it's hopeless.
author: Eric C.

description: Best potstickers ever. Hot crispy generals chicken. This place is awesome with a clean health score
author: AL M.

description:
This spot has seen several Chinese restaurants come and go, but I hope this most recent incarnation is here to stay. 

The owners are a husband/wife team and the husband (in charge of the kitchen) used to work at Mission Chinese. We've only eaten from here once so far and it was take-out but we were impressed by the quality of the ingredients and flavors. The wife (Spring) is in charge of the front of house and she's very personable and friendly. 

The previous owner remodeled the space, so it's clean and open. There's an opportunity for these owners to decorate in order to make the space feel warm and welcoming.

We'll definitely be back and I hope the neighborhood can support this new business.
author: Kate M.

description:
Traditional Chinese food! loved the scalion pancakes, and all the dishes. 
We had a large group and ate family style, it was perfect!
author: Joe H.

description: Ordered Crab Rangoon and Szechuan Chicken Win Garden for the first time tonight. The delivery was prompt and the food was very delicious. Not as spicy as I had hoped for but tasty none the less. Generous portions too!
author: Jayanthi P.

description: Got delivery, took about an hour on a Sat night. Korean chicken wings were delicious. Dragon beef seemed to have the same sauce as the wings, also very tasty.
author: Kris Marie D.

description: I love this place! I've never been inside but I can tell you that their delivery service is excellent. I have ordered over a dozen times and have not been disappointed yet. I highly recommend the Basil eggplant with prawns and scallops.
author: Lena R.

description:
Been wanting to check this place. Nice little gem. Food was very good, we had:
1. green onion pancake, thin, flaky and not oily. Very delicious
2. Chow Mein, great flavor could have used a little more noodles.
3. Asparagus with black bean sauce. It was good but I can't say I'm a fan of black bean sauce in general 
3. Shrimp with eggplant. Boyfriend loved it. 

This place is delicious and close by. Look forward to going back soon and trying other veggie platters :)
author: Belen B.

description: What a gem.  Located in Glen Park village on Diamond near Tiger's coffee shop. Best Chinese takeout around unless you head over to Henry's Hunan on Church or San Tung on Irving.  We recommend any Potsticker, Kung Pao or Mu Shu, Chinese Broccoli with Oyster Sauce, Eggplant with Spicy Garlic Sauce, Dry Sauteed Green Beans, Szechuan Chicken, Dry Braised Crispy Pork and Mongolian Beef and any chow mein (made with fresh noodles).  Fails for us are the Chow Fun which arrived as a starchy clump (it might be better if you eat in) and we're not impressed with the fried rice.  We're still working our way thru the menu.  Next up we want to try some of the Meatless Chicken dishes.  Highly recommended.
author: Pam C.

description: I ordered pick up from this place tonight. And I forgot my keys and got locked out of my house when inleft to pick up food. It is after 10 pm and they let me not only stay inside but also eat the food right here after hours while I wait for my friend. These are some really nice people. And their food is so delicious!
author: Ramya V.

description:
In my opinion basically the best Chinese food outside of the sunset, especially for vegetarians. Frankly I adore everything I get from this place and the dry braised meatless chicken is my favorite. Get the pot stickers as well, they feel way less heavy than other options around the city. I also love the salt and pepper meatless chicken and always order jalapeño chow fun! Wha!!!

P.S. Delivery has always shown up before the quoted time, even more than you would expect.

Will continue to order from here religiously and you should, too!
author: Nathan T.

description: Great take out place! Haven't really eaten at the restaurant, but food is good. The veggies sides, like the Ginger Broccoli and Sauté Green Beans was a little over cooked, but good. Love their General Tso and Jalapeño Fried Rice.
author: Jadma N.

description: Glad that I ordered their cumin lamb dish.   Tasted pretty good without being too greasy.   However would be even nicer if the ladies don't have to shot inside the kitchen.  Perhaps adding a kitchen door will fix that.
author: Tony W.

description:
sesame ball was good (a little too much bean paste)
wah won ton soup was good
author: Diane W.

description:
What a wonderful addition to Glen Park.  We have enjoyed six perfectly cooked meals here since Win Garden opened. The BEST garlic eggplant ever. It's not so easy to plate a perfect version of this classic vegetarian dish, yet Win Garden avoids grease and over-cooking of this, as all dishes, to deliver just what we asked for: medium spicy throughout, piping hot, soft-chewy-sweet-spicy goodness.  Calamari Kung Pao delivered just the same perfection. 

Brown and white rice, all noodle dishes:
Perfect! 
Rice and rice noodles seem such easy things to cook -and they are! - yet far too few restaurants match Win Garden's attention to detail in buying high quality grains and steaming/wok-sautéing them to perfection.  



Our waiter last night was attentive without being officious. He listened to just what we wanted and made sure the kitchen used no msg, little oil, plenty of spice without going overboard.  Szechuan the way it should be.  

We've had takeout from here twice before and been delighted with soups, noodles, stir fries.... We enjoyed dining in last night: simple, spotlessly clean decor matched the unpretentious, honest food and efficient, friendly service -- all at reasonable prices. 

So close to BART -- just a 3 minute walk from Glen Park Station -- less than a 10 minute gentle stroll from anywhere in Glen Park and close enough to most other SF neighborhoods to get here fast - or enjoy free home delivery - that I hope the place succeeds wildly but fear it might become so popular we could have trouble finding a seat in future.

Hot and sour soup was both hot and sour -- and just a tad overly salted. Still, it had layers of umami and a great mix of spicy, salty, and naturally sweet, to make up for the heavy hand with salt.  

We will try the free delivery soon. Or just pick it up on the way home again since it's so darn easy. Can't wait to invite friends to meet here.
author: Scott C.

description: Small place but some of the best Chinese food I've had with great prices:) great place to take the family. I recommend the wonton soup
author: Jasmin O.

description: Pretty solid food ...the general Tsao chicken was crispy and sweet and a little spicy and good and the chow mein was really good have a good amount of vegetables in it and salt pepper shrimp was okay I could have had a little more pepper on it. Now I'm already hungry from writing this because I ate it 30 minutes ago
author: Jeremy R.

description: Fresh and delicious! When put in my delivery order they told me that they were especially busy that night but they delivered within 30 minutes -- much more quickly than I was expecting. We got the lemon chicken, jalapeno chow fun noodles, and crab ragoons and it was all so good. I'd especially recommend the jalapeno chow fun if you like spicy food. Will definitely be ordering from here again!
author: Melissa D.

description: The food is good in taste. We tried the orange chicken, bok choi, egg fried rice, chow mein, and shrimp in a cream sauce. That's where the good news ends. The food gave my fiancée and myself medium and serious stomach pain, on the verge of stomach flu. In a pinch I would give them another chance, but not for any occasion. Their extremely lax treatment of credit card numbers, expiration dates, 3 digit codes, and addresses of incoming phone orders is seriously troubling. The man at the cash register would put callers on speakerphone and have them give their payment information and then repeat it back to them in full. In my 30 minutes of waiting for my order in close proximity I must have heard 6 or 7 sets of payment info. If you're ordering pick up or delivery, do so in person or via Yelp.
author: Anton U.

description: Why didn't I order here before!! I found my spot!! The food is really good and very tasty! We were literally talking about the food the following day. LOL. I never called in the order, I ordered online. But, let me tell you that the customer service was outstanding. The delivery driver was extremely polite and kept thanking me for the business. I'll definitely keep ordering.
author: Patricia G.

description:
We have not been to the restaurant, but had our supper delivered.  The delivery was here within 30 minutes of the order. The delivery man was nice and courteous.  He thanked us for ordering from Win Garden.  He made sure we had everything and he made sure that gate was firmly shut.  (This is critical because I have had to chase my Pommies down the street when other deliver folks did not close the gate after being asked to make sure it was slammed shut.)

The food was hot and delicious.  We ordered Beef with Chinese Broccoli, Tofu in Black Bean Sauce, Walnut Prawns, and Singapore Rice Noodles.  

We have found that a restaurant that does poorly on the Walnut Prawns doesn't do that well with anything.  The Walnut Prawn expert in our group thought the dish was perfect.  Lots of prawns, walnuts, and puffed rice noodles.  It was pretty to view and tasty.

My dish to order was the Beef with Chinese Broccoli.  I love Chinese Broccoli and Beef.  This dish was full flavored with both the broccoli and beef perfectly cooked.  It was a very colorful dish that was delicious to see and even better to eat.  Excellent.

Perfectly cooked braised tofu in black bean sauce is sometimes hard to get.  This lovely dish was graced with braised tofu, mushrooms and blackbean sauce.  Yummy with great mouth appeal.

The Rice Noodles, Singapore Style were perfect.  We ordered one order per person because we wanted some for breakfast or lunch tomorrow.  They were delicious.  There were prawns, meats, and veggies that were all perfectly cooked with the light curry flavored noodles.  They were soooooooo yummy.

Everything was fresh and fresh tasting.  The seasonings were wonderful.  Comparing the foods I have eaten while in Asia, I can say that it is definately NOT standard Americanized fare.  It is good cuisine We will definately order from them in the near future.
author: Gail S.

description: Best Chinese delivery I've had since moving to the area.  Will order from again.
author: Jon F.

description: I'm changing my two star rating to a three star rating, because after I got past my disappointment about the SIMILARITY of the ingredients in what I had expected to be very DIFFERENT dishes, I was able to appreciate the QUALITY of the ingredients -- especially the next day, when enjoying leftovers.
author: Marvin N.

description: I love this place. Fast delivery. Consistency. Great Customer service. The general Tsao chicken is crispy and amazing. Vegi fried rice is a must. Pork chow mein is tender. Shrimp and walnut is delightful. This food is spot on, don't know if I could order take out from anybody else. I'm loyal!
author: Ryan G.

description: This place is terrific!  We had the hot and sour soup which was delicious, the cashew chicken and the chicken with veggies were very good.  But, my favorite was the basil tofu with eggplant. Yum, yum, yum! The service is fast and friendly.  I'm going back!
author: Debra O.

description:
Best Chinese food I've had in SF, good prices, and a really great delivery experience. I ordered off the dim sum menu tonight, and I'm so glad I did. My order:

-BBQ Pork Bun: 3 delicious steamed pork buns
-Shrimp Dumplings: perfect, amazing, best ever. Delicate and light, yet warm and sticky and comforting. Fresh, real shrimp, amazing little pillows of goodness. I forget how many there were--I ate them so fast I forgot to notice!
-Turnip Cake: 3 cakes, great texture, subtle flavor, very nice
-Broccoli with Ginger Sauce: (located on the salad menu if you're using their website, but this is not salad) tender broccoli with just the right amount of snap, perfumed with fresh ginger, nicely flavored with no gooey or heavy sauce. I love this portion and price, rather than having to order a separate $10 entree just to get veggies in my meal like at most places. 

I also ordered some white rice, and I swear even the rice was better here than anywhere else, as were the dipping sauces. Their chile oil is so good I want to put it on everything in my fridge. I couldn't believe how fast my order arrived--the driver laughed and said they weren't busy. He was friendly and polite. 

Win Garden, you have won me over. I can't wait to try the rest of your menu.
author: H. M.

description:
We eat a couple of times in the restaurant. The food is decent but the service is lousy- unorganized and slow.
Today we tried to get takeout and I called the order in- I was told 25 min it would take. After 45 min from calling (waited already 20 min in the restaurant) the waiter reconfirmed my order and telephone # and told me "it would be ready in 5 min"- after the full hour we finally got the food. Unacceptable service.
Beware- the dishes come without any rice.
author: Thomas P.

description:
So just to be clear, I've seen this chinese place change names and management...and as a chinese-American, I'm going to be brutally honest. Win Garden is really good! The prices are decent and the inside of the restaurant is simple yet clean. Service is quick and friendly. But the best part? Yes, it's definitely the food and no, not msg lol. This place tastes even better than Red Jade!! In my book, if you can make vegetarians dishes taste good, then you definitely know what you're doing. Here, they make the best eggplant lunch special that I've ever tasted hands down. Yes, this establishment is new, but trust me when I tell you that the chef knows what he's doing back there and I'm so happy that I no longer have to travel all the way to church for green beans, sesame chicken or eggplant tofu...when we've got a great little chinese place here in glen park! So happy that we finally have a good chinese place after Hong Sing establishment closed. Give Win Garden a chance- they also have a dim sum menu too! 

Sidenote:
I just read some overly harsh reviews that was obviously written by some snobby wannabe critic...anyway, this place is definitely comparable to some of the other restaurants you would find in Chinatown. Maybe it's just me, but it's so annoying to hear ppl bash chinese food ... FYI - PF Chang's is not authentic chinese food in my book...and neither are the other fru fru places that purport to serve it too. The taste here is actually very close to what the food tastes like in China. Obviously, not every dish is palatable to everyone...so use your common sense and order something else because sometimes telling the waiter what you're looking for is smarter than ordering something you hope tastes like Panda Express because this ain't Panda Express and it ain't PF Chang's either. So don't get it twisted. If you're looking for yummy good old fashioned Chinese food - then this is the place to go. Good eats ya'all!!
author: Rayne W.

description: Yummy food and great veggie options- meatless orange chicken and chow mien are  great!
author: Zan L.

description: If I could give them no stars I would in a heartbeat! HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE customer service!!! We orders thru eat 24, our order hadn't been delivered in over an hour so I called and they hadn't even checked their orders online! When I complained the rude ass man said he didn't wanna argue and that he'll call to refund my money while my kids are hungry AF waiting for their bumb A** restaurant to deliver! NEVER AGAIN!
author: Diana G.

description: It was a little odd walking in on a Saturday night, because the place was nearly deserted, other than one other couple a few tables over and a worn-out TV blaring sports on the back wall.  But Win Garden won us over with good service, cloth napkins, aluminum chopsticks (but slippery!), and really well-prepared food.  I honestly was not expecting the food to taste as good as it did, and both of us agreed everything here was well above average.  The ingredients appeared to be very fresh, and everything was flavorful.  If this place were located on Valencia, Divisadero, Chestnut, or even Irving St., I think there'd be a line on weekend evenings. These guys deserve it.  So do yourself and Win Garden a favor and give 'em a try some time -- easy parking, very close to BART and MUNI, fair prices, no waiting, and very very good Mandarin-style food.
author: Richard A.

description: Perfect Chinese take out that is never greasy. Fresh ingredients, really good flavors and a great menu. Everything I have tried has been spot on. Nothing fancy, just really good Chinese food. My new go-to-spot in the neighborhood that is Glen Park.
author: Sonia S.

description: Just what we needed in our neighborhood......DELICIOUS Chinese food. Moved from SOMA (3) years and FINALLY found a place I can't live without!!!! YUMMY!
author: Melinda R.

description:
I was having a serious craving for greasy Chinese food... Ordered to-go and told them I was allergic to seafood and nuts/peanuts. I left for a few minutes to run some errands and came back. The guy told me that he told the chef to avoid shellfish, nuts/peanuts, sesame seeds, and soy sauce. I told him soy sauce was fine and to tell the chef... so he went back there and returned with the food saying that he was sorry that the food had already been prepared. The guy was nice and considerate, perhaps overly so. But maybe he needs to learn what different types of foods cause allergies, since he works in a restaurant. An allergy to nuts/peanuts doesn't mean an allergy to soy sauce. He gave me two packets of soy sauce and chili oil. I came home with white chow fun and white chicken. It tasted very underwhelming, even after I added a whole packet of soy sauce. Now I have a headache from the MSG in all that soy sauce I added and no satisfied taste buds to show for it. I spent over $20 for Chinese food and I'm still craving it.

 Also, I received no napkins or chopsticks.
author: Jeanne M.

description: Win gardens changed owners 4 or so years ago. It is a  geat neighborhood rest.   Reasonable, mostly standard fare, great service.  They also accomodate my wierd changes, mixi g things: "string bean chicken but the sauce in mongolian beef?"  ... "Sure"
author: Rich S.

description: This is a good clean Chinese food restaurant. Good Chinese restaurants are hard to find. I have eaten here 5 or 6 times, and every time it was delicious. The ingredients are good and the flavors rock. It is also quite reasonably priced.  I am really excited about having a good Chinese restaurant in the neighborhood and the city.
author: Karim D.

description: Win Garden is a must go for clean, delicious Chinese food. The front of house is courteous, thoughtful and genuine. We have lived in the Glen Park area for years and I can say I'm excited for Win Garden. Today I placed an online order to go and came in after 15 minutes and didn't expect the meal to be ready as it was a large order but figured I'd wait, wasn't in a particular hurry. The staff promised me it would be done in 5 minutes, which it was, and offered me a seat and glass of ice water right away while I waited. Impeccable customer service, great food and a decent price. Keep up the work!
author: Chris S.

description: Pretty tasty Chinese food! I enjoyed it. It's very conveniently located near my house. I ordered the fried rice and crab wontons. Obviously not as good as a place in Chinatown, but fairly cheap prices and a good location means I'm interested.
author: Chad H.

description:
I am very happy that win garden is here. Over the years I've found myself staying away from chinese food as it tended to not be very healthy and the ambiance sometimes lacking.  This restaurant not only has plenty of healthy and vegetarian recipes but it also has a really good meatless generals chicken. they also offer brown rice which is another nod to health.
The decor is pleasant, with white table clothes which offsets the TV. My only suggestions would be to dim the lights just a bit.  But maybe thats just me-- a chinese food romantic:)
oh darn-- late breaking news.  I just ordered 2 dishes and a rice order for $25 for me and a friend  and they only delivered one fortune cookie.  More importantly they delivered the dishes in plastic instead of the more planet friendly paper containers we have come to associate with take-out.  2 minuses (the first very forgiveable, the second a big but easily solved problem), but still a great addition to the neighborhood
author: Sophie O.

description: YUM! I have been looking for a place around my house that was responsibly priced with good food quality. success! clean tasting food, and not greasy at all like other places. will definitely go again! Looking forward to trying the vegan options :)
author: Lauren L.

description: Ordered via eat24. Delivery was scheduled for 50 minutes and ended up taking 1 hour 40 minutes. The food was cold and congealed and I was never given an explanation or an apology, so unfortunately there is no way I would ever recommend them. If you want to try your luck with take out or eat in, have at it. But delivery, no way. There are too many great Chinese restaurants in this city to give this one a try.
author: William N.

description: I ordered delivery for the first experience with Win Garden. It came in a reasonable amount of time and was still moderately hot. As a vegetarian, I ordered the spring rolls, General Tso's meatless chicken, broccoli with ginger sauce (app), and white rice. The spring rolls were good and seasoned well, but not a SF standout. The meatless chicken was tasty, but a bit soft. I love that they sell veggies in a smaller size then the normal $8.95...and the ginger broccoli was amazing. It was so fresh and cooked just enough with strips of fresh ginger. The rice on the other hand seemed old. I will order again and I recommend trying it out.
author: John H.

description:
I really enjoyed the food, by far the best fried rice I've had in the City. We also had Szechuan Pork which I thought was in the top 5 we've had, and an order of West Lake Beef Soup. 

We will be going back and think this restaurant stacks up well against the other restaurants in Glen Park and against the best Chinese restaurants of this style in the City.
author: Mr. K.

description: Food arrived 45 minutes after estimated delivery time (in total 1 hour 45 minutes). Had to call the restaurant directly to get an updated status, and 20 minutes later, the food arrived. Keep this in mind if you're hungry!
author: Jeremy G.

description: From reading the reviews I would have never come here and I am so glad I didn't. Just moved here and could never find a place to eat until a few weeks ago. The food is really good and very flavorful, has veggie options , and very nice staff. I come here almost everyday now
author: Rebeniric M.

description: Loved take out from this place! I had sweet and sour soup (could have been slightly spicier), broccoli beef, and pork buns. Delish. Remembering it for the future.
author: Nkat H.

description: I'm always very surprised by how good everything is here, honestly some of my favorite Chinese in the city. I've tried the General Tso's Chicken and Mapo Tofu, both were excellent. The shrimp dumplings are insanely good, as well as their pork potstickers.
author: C J.

description: I went there with a huge group. The restaurant handled that well. Everyone raved about the food. I'm taking that into consideration in giving them such a high rating. I didn't find anything that stood out. Nothing was bad. It was extremely Americanized. The avocado wontons were weird. They have Chines hot mustard. I like that. Anyway, my boyfriend now swears by the place. So, I'm eating a lot of it. Here's what isn't bad. The food is not greasy. The rice isn't mushy or hard. The vegetables are plentiful.
author: Therese M.

description: I certainly concur with other writers about the need for Glen Park to have a decent Chinese resto -- this will do just fine.  I've eaten in once and done delivery, and both times the food was well-made, fresh ingredients, and cheerfully served. The menu is very well designed, and off it I have had the Westlake soup, Hot and Sour soup, chicken wings two different ways, Mu Shu pork,  Triple Delight, sesame rolls, and turnip pancake.  I will keep exploring the menu, again both from there and my home. This is not Mission Chinese, although one of the principals has worked there, and the Mai Po Tofu shows evidence of that -- however it is a very solid repeatable choice when you get that inevitable urge for Chinese and want it here and now. Support Win Garden. I will keep going.
author: Mark P.

description: The food is bland. It needs something to make it tasty. It's good, clean food but it's bland. The portions are large, the staff is great and the place is bright, clean and quiet and the prices are fair. I've eaten there once and had takeout once (very fast delivery service). I'll be going back because the food isn't bad and it's the only Chinese option in the neighborhood AND they are open for lunch - a big plus. But honestly, if I were going to order takeout for delivery again, I'd call Mission Chinese Food.
author: Carolyn S.

description: I ordered the BBQ pork, pot stickers, wor won ton soup, and a box of white rice.  The food arrived in less than 30 minutes and was hot and ready to eat.  Everything tasted great.  I will definitely order from Win Garden again.  The total cost for the food was $28 and change and I tipped the driver $3.
author: Jerry Z.

description: Very good standard Chinese cuisine.  What's not typical of Chinese restaurants is that the place is very clean, both in the dining area and in the back of the house (based on the 98/100 inspection score I saw posted).  We will be getting takeout from here regularly.
author: Peter L.

description: This is my new go to for Chinese food. The 5 stars is because it's NOT too oily and heavy.. It's not mind blowing but its better then the competition.
author: Cindy C.

description: Came here in need of a quick meal on our way to SFO. Not only were they super accommodating, but the food was outstanding!  Super pleasant surprise, especially in light of it not being super busy, and surrounding restaurants were jammed.  We'll be back!
author: Rob D.

description: Healthier, fresher food than most other Chinese restaurants I've tried in SF--especially the quality of the veggie's, and lean chicken breast used in mixed dishes.  Chow mein I had was unusually non-greasy compared with most.  And this at a low price ($6.95 to $7.95 for lunch), in a clean, pleasant restaurant, with efficient service.  Lot's of meatless choices for vegetarians, as well as plenty of choices for meat eaters.  Don't know why this place isn't more popular; it should be.
author: Andrew S.

description: I love the food and close too home. A little pricier than other local Chinese food spots
author: Irma P.

description: I ordered from there tonight. The food was okay, as thus far I have only eaten the won-ton, shrimp, and crab Rangoon. I have yet to eat the house Chow Mein and and my Sweet and Sour Pork!  I had asked for a container of sweet and sour sauce, to dip the aforementioned dishes in!  I was sent and empty container with no lid, and 3 little portion control cups of sweet & sour sauce! It was just enough to successfully dip the shrimp in, which were small, but tasty! I called to complain that what I asked for was not given to me, and that I was given an empty pint container with no lid and the 3 little portion control cups of sweet & sour sauce. The guy continually re-iterated that they give one cup for each order! I told him that it was not enough to dip my food in! I told him that since I was paying for it, I didn't care that they usually gave 1 per order, and that I wanted what I asked for, and I had no problem paying for what I wanted!  When he began to re-iterate again, rather than argue, I informed him he should have given me what I asked for, but he needn't worry about it . . . That I would never order from his business again!  I all fairness, the delivery guy was nice, and arrived quickly, so I gave him a nice tip!  So, that is my experience with this business!  Let me make it clear I have no problem paying for what I want! If it cost a dollar extra, I would have gladly paid the dollar! I don't care what you "usually do," I want to know that you could do what I ask if you can't you should have informed me when I ordered it! Anyway, because of his behavior, this business has lot a good customer! Thus the low score!
author: Veronika F.

description: the newest chinese food addition to glen park. big portions, fair prices, nice people, pretty authentic food.
author: Sonya Z.

description: horrible service.  we were the only customers in the place. we sat waiting for 15 minutes while the waiter walked around and ignored us and never gave us menus. we decided that this was a sign of more to come, so we left.  never going back again.
author: william c.

description: Decidedly above average Chinese food, but exceptional service.  They got part of our to go order wrong (included those dreaded bean sprouts although we requested no bean sprouts)... Of course we didn't realize until getting home.  Didn't expect much in terms of correcting the problem but called anyways to let them know, and they offered to redo the order AND deliver it so we wouldn't have to go back.  They even recognized their error and apologized. Maybe I have really low standards but I didn't expect that level of customer service for Chinese take out.  Food was also great so they've won us over and we'll definitely return!
author: Mana B.

description: We didn't know where to go on Christmas day for dinner. Win Garden was open, so we gave it a try. We were all very happy with the experience. The food was really good. In the neighborhood, good food, and open on Christmas.
author: Linda E.

description: I've gotten dinner delivered twice and have been very happy each time. The food was yummy, good sized portions, fresh and arrived quickly. WIn Garden is several steps up from the quality of the food in the previous two Chinese restaurants that occupied the same space, and beats out other Chinese delivery I've sampled in this area. Glad they are here in GP, hope they stay.
author: Lisa M.

description: Best Chinese food delivery in the Glen Park / Diamond Heights area. Great flavor and affordable.
author: Steven G.

description: I was visiting from Los Angeles and ate there the other night. The spring rolls are a must get and same with the crab puff. If you are in the area and like Chinese food should should defiantly eat here.
author: Gram N.

description: I really hope this restaurant makes it.  I was depressed when the previous Chinese restaurant in this spot, China House, closed after only 6 months.  Glen Park needs a decent Chinese restaurant.  I've been to Win Garden twice now, and I ready to say that it has found one.  It is better than China House, and is the kind of good (but not fancy or expensive) Chinese restaurant that every neighborhood should have.  If you live in Glen Park, you should go here.
author: Daniel A.
